basics.name: Yun Zhang
basics.label: Researcher
basics.summary: A highly motivated researcher with experience in computational mathematics, data science, and machine learning, with a particular interest in multi-modality medical imaging and sensor configurations at smart intersections.

education.area: B.S. in Computational Mathematics, B.S. in Statistics and Data Science

education.institution: American Community School of Athens (ACS Athens)

research.name: Mobility Lab, UCLA
research.summary: Utilized CARLA, OPENCDA, and ScenarioRunner for the Analysis of Multi-camera sensor configuration at smart intersections, including BEVFormer, SparseBEV, SOLOFusion, and our model. Conducted scenario design, database creation, and relationship analysis of multi-liDAR camera sensors configuration.
highlights: Participating in the U.S. DOT Intersection Safety Challenge and designed the trajectory modification tool for the manual improvement of road user and vehicle trajectories as an intermediate step between detection and prediction

research.name: Vwani Roychowdhury's Lab, UCLA
research.summary: Contributed to the implementation and deep learning models of Hilbert (HIL) detector of PyHFO, a multi-window desktop application providing time-efficient HFO detection algorithms for artifact and HFO with spike classification
highlights: Reduced the detection run-time by 50 times compared to state-of-the-art with comparative study to ensure correctness.

research.name: HKU Summer Research Program
research.summary: Leveraged Large Language Models (MiniGPT-4) for multi-modality brain tumor segmentation, integrating four distinct MRI modalities (T1c, T1w, T2c, and FLAIR) onto a common space to enhance segmentation accuracy.
highlights: Awarded Best Presenter and received a PhD offer with a Presidential Scholarship.

work.name: Office of Palo Alto Councilmember Greg Tanaka
work.summary: Analyzed voter data from public social media, HubSpot, and voter profiles within a California congressional district, identifying trends and developing predictive models to anticipate voting behavior
highlights: Utilized LLMs to generate personalized campaign emails and campaign services, increasing efficiency.

work.name: Uber, Hong Kong
work.summary: Participated in the facial mask recognition project during the COVID-19 pandemic for backend utilities
highlights: Performed in-depth analysis and demand forecasting for Uber's regional operations, evaluating the influence of factors such as humidity, wind, time of day, as well as origin and destination

publications.name: Analysis of Multi-Camera and LiDAR Sensor Placement at Intersections: Evaluating Configurations Under Varied Scenarios and Weather Conditions Using Surrogate Metrics
publications.summary: Co-first author, this paper evaluates multi-camera and LiDAR sensor configurations under various scenarios and weather conditions, using surrogate metrics to optimize sensor placement for smart intersections. The paper will be submitted in September 2024 to ICRA.

publications.name: Expanding the Utility of PyHFO: Lightweight Deep Learning-powered End-to-End High-Frequency Oscillations Analysis Application
publications.summary: Second author, this paper presents PyHFO, a lightweight deep learning-powered application designed for end-to-end analysis of high-frequency oscillations (HFOs) in EEG data. It will be submitted in December 2024 to the Journal of Neural Engineering.

publications.name: Optimization Strategies for Sensor Placement in Multi-Camera and LiDAR-Camera Systems at Intersections: Tools, Models, and Adversarial Scene Enhancements
publications.summary: Second author, this paper explores optimization techniques for sensor placement in multi-camera and LiDAR-camera systems at intersections, focusing on adversarial scene enhancements. It will be submitted in December 2024 to RA-L.

publications.name: Transforming Political Campaigns: The Impact of AI-Generated Personalized Emails on Voter Behavior
publications.summary: Fourth author, this paper examines how AI-generated personalized emails influence voter behavior in political campaigns. The paper has been submitted to American Political Science.
